channel.title: Every client crashes after I log on
channel.description:
Hey everytime I log onto any server with the updated client for it my client crashes and leaves a wierd text document in the client folder named "hs_err_pid" with random numbers at the end. In the text document it reads this... [code]# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d8e1d76, pid=4980, tid=608 # # JRE version: 6.0_15-b03 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (14.1-b02 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x51d76] # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp #
--------------- T H R E A D ---------------
Current thread (0x000000001b45b000): JavaThread "CompilerThread1" daemon [_thread_in_native, id=608, stack(0x000000001bbc0000,0x000000001bcc0000)]
siginfo: ExceptionCode=0xc0000005, reading address 0x0000000000000000
Registers: EAX=0x00000000212bd240, EBX=0x0000000020a25b90, ECX=0x00000000212bd210, EDX=0x000000001bcbc720 ESP=0x000000001bcbc2c0, EBP=0x000000001c7f4f10, ESI=0x000000001bcbc720, EDI=0x00000000212bd210 EIP=0x000000006d8e1d76, EFLAGS=0x0000000000010206

[/code] I also put a video on youtube of the problem heres the link: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ACsFpKgYsNw How do I fix this?

item.title: Every client crashes after I log on
item.dc:creator: @muubo muubo
item.description:
@muubo wrote:

are you 64 bit vista? i did the same exact thing on my 64 bit vista comp as i did on my 32 bit vista comp and the 32 works but 64 will not it does the same thing as whats going on here has crashes etc etc etc…soooo its not a java problem its a problem that it only works on 32 bit vista or xp and older

Read full topic
item.source: Every client crashes after I log on

item.title: Every client crashes after I log on
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Barter Owner Barter
item.description:
@Owner_Barter wrote:

Sn1p3r:

same problem on Windows 7

Well,maybe he changed something in the java,did you edit anything (not knowing if you can edit anything in the java because i’ve never fucked with mine)
But maybe you edited something and saved it by accident.

Read full topic

This is a java error, tell java what happened and what program it was from.

item.description:
@bbl111 wrote:

Nah this is a java error. Send it to java, and hope they can fix.

@Vexx wrote:

do you have JDK? sometimes you need that to get clients to work.
